subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Is this group defunct?
msgSnippet: On Sun, Jul 16, 2017 at 8:16 PM, mailinglists@ngalt.com [Read_Alphabet]  wrote: It looks neat if you re going for a Hebrew
messageBody:
On Sun, Jul 16, 2017 at 8:16 PM, mailinglists@... [Read_Alphabet] <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

It looks neat if you're going for a Hebrew vibe, but I'm 99% sure it has even fewer vowel sounds than Quikscript.

It's about equivalent: it has 16 vowels, none of which are r-colored except the NURSE vowel, which means you have to write his R to produce the NEAR, SQUARE, START, NORTH, FORCE, and CURE vowels.

There are a variety of exaggerations in the text.  For example, only about 15-20% of words are truly irregularly spelled, like "one".  The rules for the rest are complex and context-dependent, but they exist.

-- 
John Cowan          http://vrici.lojban.org/~cowan        cowan@...
No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the
continent, a part of the main.  If a clod be washed away by the sea,
Europe is the less, as well as if a promontory were, as well as if a
manor of thy friends or of thine own were: any man's death diminishes me,
because I am involved in mankind, and therefore never send to know for
whom the bell tolls; it tolls for thee.  --John Donne

Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com> wrote:

It looks neat if you're going for a Hebrew vibe, but I'm 99% sure it has
> even fewer vowel sounds than Quikscript.


It's about equivalent: it has 16 vowels, none of which are r-colored except
the NURSE vowel, which means you have to write his R to produce the NEAR,
SQUARE, START, NORTH, FORCE, and CURE vowels.

There are a variety of exaggerations in the text.  For example, only about
15-20% of words are truly irregularly spelled, like "one".  The rules for
the rest are complex and context-dependent, but they exist.

-- 
John Cowan          http://vrici.lojban.org/~cowan        cowan@...
No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the
